summary: This is an email from an Assistant U.S. Attorney summarizing a call with defense attorney Roy Black regarding the Jeffrey Epstein case. The discussion centers on a potential plea deal from State Attorney Barry Krischer and the federal prosecutors' position that any state plea must not breach a prior agreement with Epstein, which is contingent on him stopping a process in Washington.

persons.name: Roy Black
persons.context: Defense attorney who called to discuss wrapping up the Epstein case before July 7th and inquired about the implications of a potential state plea deal.

persons.name: Rolando
persons.context: Mentioned as having discussed the matter with Barry Krischer, but the email clarifies substantive case communications are being handled by the author and another person.

persons.name: Barry Krischer
persons.context: State Attorney who has reportedly offered a 60-day plea deal to Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeff Sloman
persons.context: Mentioned as the author of a letter regarding the matter of Epstein's incarceration, specifically about not taking a position on where he would be incarcerated.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the criminal case and potential plea negotiations. The federal prosecutors' position is that any state plea must not breach a prior agreement with him.

connections.description: Roy Black is acting as defense counsel, calling prosecutors to discuss plea options for Epstein.
Krischer, as State Attorney, has offered a 60-day plea deal to Epstein.
Rolando had previously discussed the Epstein matter with Barry Krischer, according to Roy Black.

events.title: Call with Roy Black
events.description: A call between an Assistant U.S. Attorney and defense attorney Roy Black to discuss the status of the Epstein case, specifically a potential state plea deal and the federal prosecutors' position.

events.title: Potential Deadline
events.description: Roy Black inquired about wrapping up the Epstein case before this date.

locations: 500 S. Australian Ave, Suite 400 West Palm Beach, FL 33401
keyFacts: Defense attorney Roy Black was seeking to resolve the Epstein case before July 7, 2008, and inquired if federal prosecutors would 'go away' if Epstein accepted State Attorney Barry Krischer's 60-day plea deal.
Federal prosecutors stated their position was conditional: if Epstein 'stops the process in Washington' and abides by a signed agreement, they would perform pursuant to that agreement.

Federal prosecutors explicitly stated that if Epstein pleads to a different charge or receives a lower sentence at the state level, they would consider it a breach of their agreement and would 'proceed accordingly'.
The email references a prior 'signed agreement' between federal prosecutors and Epstein, the terms of which are not fully detailed but are central to the negotiations.
The author, an Assistant U.S. Attorney, indicates that all substantive communication regarding the case is being handled by them and another person, not Rolando.
